text: Hello, everyone!
I hope you all know just how much I enjoy posting lessons
here on YouTube for English language learners like yourself.
Over the years, I've tried different ways to provide additional support and practice.
Some of you know that on my website I have a collection of interactive exercises.
Just visit my website, look under students, and you'll find that collection.
Did you also know that I'm on Twitter?
Follow me on Twitter for everyday vocabulary practice.
I have a special task Monday through Friday.
I call it the Daily Pic.
"Pic" is short for "picture."
Early in the day I post a photo and I ask some questions.
Later in the day, I give the answers.
It's a quick and easy way to gain regular vocabulary practice.
I'm also on Facebook pretty much 7 days a week.
So that's an additional place to join me
and gain additional practice.
There's one more platform I'd like to tell you about.
It's new. It's called Simor.
Simor is an intellectual network.
It's a community of learners.
I'm in the English (language) Room.
And you can join me there for free.
You can gain regular practice throughout the week
and develop skills like vocabulary, writing, grammar, and more.
As I said, it's free to join.
You can use your Facebook or LinkedIn account.
I truly hope you'll take advantage of all these opportunities,
and I particularly hope to see more of you on Simor.org.
As always, thanks for watching and happy studies!
